function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Failure to maintain pressure differentials leading to inadequate cleanliness control","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incorrect operation of heat recovery devices leading to inadequate control of air quality","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conflicting recommendations on temperature and humidity setpoints from different guidelines","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unclear ventilation rate guidelines for minimizing infectious disease risk","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Controversy over the effectiveness of temperature and humidity changes in inactivating the virus","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Low relative humidity increases the risk of infection","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation increases the risk of transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective air cleaning and filtration","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Possibility of sars-cov-2 transmission through air and hvac systems","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistent guidelines for air-conditioning system operation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of compliance with ashrae guidelines for building operations during the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient maintenance of water seals and ventilation pipes","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unequal access to housing exacerbates public health crisis","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of scrutiny on the relationship between housing, health, and social inequality","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Assumption of housing as a determinant of health inequality without sustained scrutiny","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The covid-19 pandemic exacerbating social inequality, housing insecurity, and health disparities","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Home as a locus of social harm during the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient regulation of harm in housing policy discourses","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex and recursive relationship between social inequality, housing, and health","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low scientific impact of papers addressing the relationship between housing and health","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty in establishing indirect connections between housing and health outcomes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The link between housing conditions and health outcomes is not fully understood, leaving a gap in knowledge about the potential spread of contagious diseases in certain living environments.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unclear causation between poor quality housing and health outcomes creates uncertainty about the impact of living conditions on contagious disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inequality in access to housing and its impact on health outcomes creates a social gradient that may contribute to differential exposure to contagious diseases.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unclear mechanisms for generating well-being or poor health","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Correlation mistaken for causation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Transmission of social harms leading to health inequalities within the built environment","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Amplification of pre-existing health inequalities within the home environment","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Psycho-social impact of home instability and housing uncertainties on health and well-being","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contagious diseases in overcrowded housing conditions due to inadequate housing","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Social harm from lack of wholesome food and exposure to various forms of danger","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Structural context of social problems contributing to preventable harm","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of access to affordable heating and suitable housing","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Structural housing harms such as homelessness, financialization, predatory lending, rogue landlordism, housing displacement, evictions, deregulation, loss of life and homes in disasters","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of the term ’social murder’ and structural ’violence turn’ in housing studies","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to damp, mould, cold, polluted, over-crowded, noisy dwellings","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Coercive control, physical, psychological or sexual violence by an intimate partner or family member","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Fire safety and carbon monoxide risk","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to health hazards in the built environment during covid-19 lockdowns","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Neglect of safety hazards in dwellings causing anxiety and injury","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of social gradient in harm within different welfare regimes","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unequal impacts of covid-19 pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overwhelmed academic publishing and research output","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Deleterious consequences of lockdown measures for health","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential for inadequate review of covid-19 impacts leading to misinformation and ineffective policies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Shift from traditional intellectual engagement to quick, ’what works’ strategies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rapid reporting on a wide range of research papers with limited rigor and depth","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exposure to covid-19 in the built environment","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Mental distress and harm from home-based impacts","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited capacity for systematic review due to time constraints","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"}]}
